trans-unit.source: Represents a selectable item inside a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabControl"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabItem> is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedContentControl>.
Its content property is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> and its header property is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedContentControl.Header%2A>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedContentControl> class.
Customizing the TabControl Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabItem> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabItem>, see [TabControl Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/tabcontrol-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabItem> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem"></xref> is selected.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`

<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.BindsTwoWayByDefault%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsParentMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Journal%2A>
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem"></xref> is selected; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem.IsSelected"></xref> dependency property.
Responds when an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AccessText.AccessKey"></xref> for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabControl"></xref> is called.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Input.AccessKeyEventArgs"></xref>.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> property changes.
Old value of the content property.
New value of the content property.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabControl.ContentTemplate"></xref> property changes.
Old value of the content template property.
New value of the content template property.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabControl.ContentTemplateSelector"></xref> property changes.
Old value of the content template selector.
New value of the content template selector.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TabItemAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] automation infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Responds to the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> event.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs"></xref>.
Announces that the keyboard is focused on this element.
Keyboard input event arguments.
Called to indicate that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem.IsSelected"></xref> property has changed to `true`.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Selected"></xref> event.
Called to indicate that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem.IsSelected"></xref> property has changed to `false`.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Unselected"></xref> event.
Gets the tab strip placement.
This property cannot be set.
It gets its value from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabControl.TabStripPlacement%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the parent <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabControl>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Dock"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Dock.Top"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem.TabStripPlacement"></xref> dependency property.
